Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2009 04:15PM bean421 wrote: So I have to wait until my period starts to schedule my MRI. It's seriously late and I think it's stress, but its just unnerving. Everytime my body has some weird feeling I think it's cancer and that it's spreading everywhere. I wish I could calm myself down.
Posts.Title: Next Steps bean421 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2010 10:59AM bean421 wrote: I called the breast center on the 30th and they hadn't seen the report yet from the radiologist. I have a follow-up with my BS on the 5th so I'll most likely hear the results then. My prayer is that the rad saw nothing concerning and took his time getting the report to my BS. Thanks for the B9 wishes. Happy New Year!
Posts.Title: Nexts Steps Update bean421 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: bean421 wrote: Hi, I'm 29 and new here. On Tuesday I went in for my annual and my Dr found two lumps in my right breast. Given that I have a very strong family history (mom, both grandmothers) he sent me for a mammogram and ultrasound that day.  Both reports came back without showing anything.  My Dr says I should be grateful, but I just can't help but wonder why something I can feel would not show up on either test.  What should my next steps be? I'm worried sick about this whole situation. Thanks Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Next Steps bean421 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2009 09:26AM bean421 wrote: I contacted the breast center in my area and am scheduling an appointment to talk with a surgeon. You have all been so helpful.  This is such a scary time for me. I have an 18 month old little boy and the thought of not being here for him terrifies me.  The woman at the center was very helpful and they will be contacting my GP and having all of my films and reports sent to the surgeon before my appointment. Hopefully I don't have to wait too long.
Posts.Title: Next Steps bean421 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2009 03:31PM bean421 wrote: Lisa, thanks for the response. I called a breast center and was actually able to get an appointment with a surgeon tomorrow! My GP sent over his approval.  I'm a little nervous but know I'm on the right road. I'm not sure what to expect tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Next Steps bean421 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2009 06:52PM bean421 wrote: Well today went well. The Dr said that he could feel one of the lumps but said it felt like fatty tissue.  Since nothing showed up on the ultrasound or mamm he was encouraged but has scheduled me for an MRI in two weeks.  I feel a lot better now and hope that the MRI comes back clean. Thanks so much for the support.
Posts.Title: Next Steps bean421 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2009 04:30PM bean421 wrote: Thanks for the reply. I still haven't heard anything but am just really struggling with keeping calm and not imagining being diagnosed at Stage IV.  The women here are amazing. I'm wondering if it would be ok for me to call the breast center and see if they had my report ready?
Posts.Title: Nexts Steps Update bean421 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2010 07:12PM bean421 wrote: I met with the BS today and my MRI was clear!  He wants to follow-up with me in 4 months and speak with a genetic counselor.  I'm just so happy with the results.  Thank you ladies for your support. You are truly amazing women.
Posts.Title: Nexts Steps Update bean421 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: bean421 wrote: Well, I had my MRI today.  It wasn't as bad as I thought it would be and I should have the results sometime next week. I'm really trying to keep myself from being too stressed out, which I think has been affecting me physically. Thanks so much for your support. I'm not sure what kind of results the radiologist gives over the phone. Any ideas? Log in to post a reply
